law.text:
Except by previous agreement between providers and insurers, any health insurer failing to accept the uniform claim form developed pursuant to the provisions of KRS 304.14-135 as the sole instrument for reimbursement shall:
For violations occurring prior to January 1, 1991, be fined one hundred dollars ($100) per claim form rejected; and
For violations occurring after January 1, 1991, have its certificate of authority revoked in addition to being fined one hundred dollars ($100) per violation. The rejection of each claim form shall constitute a violation.
law.history: Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 482, sec. 25, effective July 13, 1990.
